title: Account Manager
content:
Overview
You will be responsible for managing complex digital projects for clients, ensuring that projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of all stakeholders. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams of Strategy, Creative, and Production to plan, execute, and deliver high-quality digital campaigns that meet client objectives and drive business results.
Accountabilities/Core Duties

Work with clients to define project objectives and dev
elop digital strategies that align with their business goals. 
Plan and execute digital projects, including defining project scope, objectives, timelines, and budgets. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams of Strategy, Creative, and Production to ensure projects are completed on time and to the satisfaction of all stakeholders. 
Develop and maintain project plans, timelines, and budgets, and track progress against project milestones. 
Communicate project requirements, objectives, and progress updates to stakeholders at all levels. 
Use data and analytics to measure and analyze campaign performance, and make data-driven decisions to optimize campaign results. 
Troubleshoot technical issues and work with developers to resolve them. 
Anticipate potential roadblocks and develop contingency plans to keep projects on track. 
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and ensure that projects are completed within budget and on time.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field. 
Proven experience as a Digital Project Manager or similar role, with a portfolio of work that demonstrates your ability to manage complex digital projects for clients. 
Experience working in an advertising agency or digital marketing agency, with a solid understanding of digital marketing channels and trends. 
Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools, such as Agile, and experience using project management software, such as Asana, Trello, or Jira. 
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, clients, and external partners. 
Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills, with the ability to identify issues and develop effective solutions. 
Detail-oriented with a commitment to maintaining high standards for project quality, including accuracy, consistency, relevance, and accessibility. 
Experience managing budgets and timelines, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, clients, and external partners.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making

Who you are
PROJECT MANAGEMENT
You should have:

A strong understanding of project management methodologies and tools, and be able to develop project plans, timelines, and budgets.
Be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, track progress, and communicate updates to stakeholders. 

DIGITAL MARKETING
You should have:

A solid understanding of digital marketing channels, including social media, email, search, and display advertising.
Be able to work with clients to define project objectives and develop digital strategies that align with their business goals. 

COMMUNICATION
You should have:

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, clients, and external partners.
Be able to clearly communicate project requirements, objectives, and progress updates to stakeholders at all levels. 

ANALYTICS
You should be:

Comfortable working with data and analytics platforms to measure and analyze campaign performance.
Be able to use data to identify trends, develop insights, and make data-driven decisions.

TECHNICAL SKILLS
You should be:

Familiar with digital production tools and technologies, such as content management systems (CMS), digital asset management systems (DAM), and project management software (i.e. asana, smartsheet, etc.).
Able to troubleshoot technical issues and work with developers to resolve them. 

PROBLEM-SOLVING
You should be able:

To identify and solve problems quickly and effectively, and be comfortable making decisions under pressure.
To anticipate potential roadblocks and develop contingency plans to keep projects on track.

We are a worldwide creative agency that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more brilliant work we can create together.At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
